Florence Nightingale, founder of modern nursing, once said, “I am of certain convinced that the greatest heroes are those who do their duty in the daily grind of domestic affairs whilst the world whirls as a maddening dreidel.” Throughout Nurse Appreciation Week, which starts with National School Nurse Day and concludes on Florence Nightingale’s birthday, we acknowledge the vital role nurses play in society. There are more than 95,000 school nurses in the United States who make a difference in the lives of children every day.

We’d like to specifically acknowledge our five extraordinary nurses: Caroline Bormann (FECC), Bonnie Rashbaum (HES), Pam Griffin (OES), Lori Bromley (WMS), and Janice Nolan (HHS).

Whether you are a nurse in a school setting, on the frontlines in a hospital, or somewhere in between, we thank you for all you do!

However, 138 Eagle Street in Albany, the New York State Executive Mansion, holds its own as a symbol of history and tradition within the state. The Executive Mansion has been home home to 32 of New York’s 56 Governors. Samuel Tilden was the first Governor to reside in the mansion in 1875 and he convinced the legislature to purchase the property two years later. Over the last 150 years, the inhabitants have updated, altered, and modernized the property. During my virtual visit, I read about efforts that were made to “green” the Mansion. In April 2009, the Mansion was awarded LEED Gold Certification for its commitment to reducing energy usage, transitioning the building to clean, renewable energy resources, and developing sustainable practices in maintaining the grounds and operation. Can any of our Hewlett or Ogden students name a current or former Governor of New York? What are some responsibilities of a Governor? Do you know the branch of government the Governor belongs to?

post_text: The Hewlett High School Virtual Enterprise program is proud to announce that one of its firms has made it to the Long Island Business Plan Championship Round. The ReStyle team scored in the Top 10, out of over 100 firms, for their written business plan and oral presentation, moving them forward to the next round of competition. The presentation team includes Anna Bromfeld, Brandon Lake, Aiden Blumenstein, Theo Franks, Andrew Gelman, and Aaron Mindell. They will compete in the beginning of March with a chance to move on to the National competition.
